unnormalised: Someone asked me about intellectual property law in India, so I thought I'd share a simplified overview. In India, intellectual property (IP) is primarily governed by several Acts, including the Patents Act 1970, the Copyright Act 1957, the Trade Marks Act 1999, and the Designs Act 2000. These laws protect various forms of IP, such as inventions, literary and artistic works, trademarks, and industrial designs. It is crucial to understand the nuances of each Act to ensure adequate protection for your IP assets. Filing a patent can cost anywhere between Rs. 5000-Rs. 25000, depending on whether you are an individual or a company.

These laws protect various forms of I-P, such as inventions, literary and artistic works, trademarks, and industrial designs. Filing a patent can cost anywhere between rupees five thousand to rupees twenty five thousand, depending on whether you are an individual or a company.
